import MethodEndpoint from "@theme/ApiExplorer/MethodEndpoint";
import ParamsDetails from "@theme/ParamsDetails";

import Heading from "@theme/Heading";

<Heading
  as={"h1"}
  className={"openapi__heading"}
  children={"Edit Device Configuration Parameter"}
>
</Heading>

<MethodEndpoint
  method={"post"}
  path={"/integration/network/{deviceID}/params"}
  context={"endpoint"}
>
  
</MethodEndpoint>



Edit a device configuration parameter using the Network-token. You must already have the device ID to use this endpoint.
This is useful when your Network integration requires configuration parameters for performing downlinks, or if your decoder benefits from configuration parameters for parsing data.
:::info
To obtain the **Device ID**, first resolve the device-token, then use the [Device Information](/docs/api/current-device-information) endpoint to retrieve detailed information about the device.
:::

<Heading
  id={"request"}
  as={"h2"}
  className={"openapi-tabs__heading"}
  children={"Request"}
>
</Heading>

<ParamsDetails
  parameters={[{"name":"deviceID","in":"path","required":true,"schema":{"type":"string"}}]}
>
  
</ParamsDetails>

<RequestSchema
  title={"Body"}
  body={{"content":{"application/json":{"schema":{"type":"array","items":{"type":"object","properties":{"id":{"type":"string","example":"6114b901cd09d0fa0013636afcc"},"key":{"type":"string","example":"downlink_url"},"sent":{"type":"boolean","example":true},"value":{"type":"string","example":"https://mydownlink.url.io"}}},"example":[{"id":"6114b901cd09d0fa0013636afcc","key":"downlink_url","sent":true,"value":"https://mydownlink.url.io"}]},"examples":{"Edit Device Configuration Parameter":{"value":[{"id":"6114b901cd09d0fa0013636afcc","key":"downlink_url","sent":true,"value":"https://mydownlink.url.io"}]}}}}}}
>
  
</RequestSchema>
